rootCause: Poorly secured in-store Wi-Fi networks (using WEP) allowed attackers to access the corporate network and exploit vulnerabilities to steal data.
impact: Theft of over 45 million credit and debit card numbers over an 18-month period, resulting in massive financial losses and fines.
description: In one of the earliest mega-breaches, attackers led by Albert Gonzalez exploited weak Wi-Fi security at TJX retail stores. They maintained access for over a year, siphoning payment card data from the company's payment processing systems, setting a precedent for large-scale retail breaches.

sources.title: The TJX data breach: 15 years later
